58866E97B679426BA26420FE0D544C7C.description: apply mathematical skills correctly in food preparation tasks (e.g., convert between metric and imperial measures; calculate yield changes)

8BDB33D1BA8349DC8EA2877F11C729CC.description: demonstrate the ability to follow a variety of recipe formats

F331B65462B8408880BD04544E3E9973.description: compare various recipe formats (e.g., narrative, standard, active)

36C52CAC221D453F8936DA7EA636AB07.description: describe useful information found in cookbooks and other sources of recipes (e.g., conversion charts, nutrition information, cooking techniques, food-related terminology, storage tips)

506258D0B97C4746B34A17E7FBE91DBF.description: identify various sources of recipes (e.g., cookbooks, the Internet, newspapers, magazines, food packages, appliance manuals, recommendations from family or friends)

FF21DF0968E04F9D9C0D08358F116A73.description: Kitchen Literacy and Numeracy: demonstrate the literacy and numeracy skills required in food preparation.

8AC4D35C4C434CB785076E12016E5ACB.description: plan, prepare, and serve a food item or items according to set criteria

4C31D771206947F9BE88917DF4A5AB8E.description: demonstrate the ability to manage time effectively in food preparation

44FBD4E40D99420FA71DC3329B834982.description: demonstrate the correct use of foodpreparation techniques (e.g., stirring, beating, whipping, chopping, broiling, frying)

F27C53E98A7B42ABB9F925ECB4261DE9.description: demonstrate the ability to measure quantities accurately (e.g., use different strategies for measuring wet and dry ingredients; level off excess amounts; measure liquids at eye level)

6C24971FC69F412FB5A8287F4E039680.description: demonstrate the ability to safely use, maintain, clean, and store tools and equipment used in food preparation

97C9D5962BA4422190AA98FADE77C14F.description: identify and select appropriate kitchen tools, equipment, and ingredients for use in food preparation

CC031566817040DD9AB577C6087D3B47.description: Food Preparation: demonstrate skills needed in food preparation;

2B78B2C7CF7946F999CB632B2B955C6B.description: follow appropriate protocols to ensure food safety (e.g., cook foods to recommended temperatures; keep hot foods hot and cold foods cold; store food appropriately; wipe tops of cans before opening; check "best-before" dates; demonstrate awareness of common allergenic ingredients)

05265D331E974E6F9834CDED1F304727.description: demonstrate the use of safe food-handling practices required to prevent cross-contamination by pathogens, parasites, and allergens in the food-preparation area (e.g., wash fresh produce; sanitize cutting boards after contact with meat products; sanitize implements that come into contact with allergens when preparing food for or with people with known allergies; sanitize work surfaces; replace and/or sanitize sponges and cloths frequently; use proper clean-up procedures)

838F9400E65B4F5690814E47288ECA9C.description: use appropriate personal hygiene practices to prevent contamination of food (e.g., wash hands frequently; cover a cough or sneeze in their sleeve; use gloves to cover cuts or wounds; tie hair back)

A58D7F75F6434A2B8B3553DCEFE0727C.description: describe the causes and symptoms of foodborne illnesses (e.g., E. Coli poisoning, botulism poisoning, Clostridium perfringens poisoning, salmonellosis, listeriosis) and techniques for preventing them

FCDB28B78C3D43FCA3B78C3FB2331A86.description: Food Safety: demonstrate an understanding of practices that ensure or enhance food safety;

D779CD85AC9C4EC5B8EC7903912A4102.description: demonstrate an understanding of appropriate emergency responses to common accidents associated with food preparation (e.g., cuts, burns, scalds, fires)

97B038F349084A86909A8F3CE3FB3085.description: demonstrate an understanding of safe practices within the food-preparation area (e.g., safely handle hot foods; prevent spatters, scalds, and cuts; wipe up spills immediately)

D28E29E44B5D454A828C8220B409D1E4.description: describe common accidents that can occur in the kitchen (e.g., cuts, burns, fires, falls, poisoning, electric shocks)

AEA6FDA1E1C9498F862C68569CF5A903.description: Kitchen Safety: demonstrate an understanding of practices that ensure or enhance kitchen safety;

D10A2CFD30BE43508E0A654E3466798A.description: identify local programs to increase food security (e.g., education programs, food banks, community kitchens, community gardens), and assess their effectiveness

0D88B783604A4E2D81568DEEF06963C3.description: identify some misconceptions and myths about hunger (e.g., it does not happen in Canada; there is not enough food in the world), and explain the reasons for them

C87713328F244BDF99B201E11D4928AE.description: explain why some people in Canada cannot achieve food security (e.g., lack of access to safe drinking water in smaller communities or communities with deteriorating infrastructure; low income; lack of knowledge about nutrition or food preparation; lack of resources or lack of access to resources; poor growing conditions or low crop yields as a result of soil depletion or natural disasters)

C02FA2C9DB074C87969413900E1C7B01.description: identify the components of food security (e.g., availability, accessibility, adequacy, acceptability, sustainability)

E5EEE11FB20B438EA823F855171FEF6D.description: Food Security: demonstrate an understanding of issues related to food security.

2BA44F7739B240A6A3C0FC0E5FC929BC.description: outline environmentally responsible foodrelated strategies that can be used in the home (e.g., using cooking techniques that require less energy, cultivating home vegetable gardens, packing lunches in reusable containers, using reusable shopping bags, buying in bulk, recycling, vermi-composting)

F810F0C50971402191F5A394D2EF71A5.description: assess programs and practices that reduce the impact of food production and consumption on the environment (e.g., recycling programs, organic farming, food co-ops, community gardens)

D43004F8E8CB4320BD0966B286167445.description: assess their personal and family foodpurchasing and food-preparation practices to determine their effect on the environment (e.g., local foods require less fossil fuel for transportation; homemade foods require less packaging)

16B8C43D72214B5EA964DDB0D4CC4415.description: Food and Environmental Responsibility: demonstrate an understanding of how various foodpurchasing choices and food-preparation practices affect the environment;

6DD208E4B4B945E0919291D18D9BCF55.description: plan and prepare a food item or items and identify the source of most of the ingredients

E401FFC9690949B490569997425962C4.description: identify factors that influence where people choose to shop for food (e.g., local grocery store, bulk-food store, big-box store, farmers' market, roadside stand, pick-your-own farm)

D28653C8065042C1BB1444EF76754609.description: explain why certain foods are imported from other countries (e.g., tropical fruits, nuts, ocean fish, coffee, tea, chocolate)

C7DB0C8A80FE4623999F6A71390A4BA3.description: explain how various factors affect the availability of local foods (e.g., proximity to agricultural land, length of growing season, presence of infrastructure such as greenhouses or fish farms, weather, soil conditions)

606D6DD625D145A29418EBC2622EFD22.description: identify the different types of foods produced in Canada (e.g., fish, meat and poultry, dairy products, grains, vegetables, fruit)

28F470A80015400498BFB96D6C148017.description: Availability of Food: demonstrate an understanding of where various foods are produced;

6ED0F7B25CC24A809974853C847D33BA.description: analyse their personal food choices to determine the extent to which they are influenced by media and advertising/promotional techniques

EFCC92B67020459C8D2336DB208D43E2.description: analyse techniques that are commonly used to promote food products (e.g., celebrity endorsements, selective limiting of information, scare tactics, brand recognition, product placement, end-of-aisle displays)

D51E20C540424BE9B6726A5692E04837.description: describe how various media (e.g., flyers, magazines, billboards, radio, television, the Internet) are used to promote the consumption of different types of foods (e.g., fresh produce, health foods, fast foods, energy drinks, restaurant meals)

E813B825C1644C0BB702E0293F062299.description: Media, Advertising, and Food: demonstrate an understanding of how media and advertising messages affect food choices.

7378F33F485C4393A00905AA3134E447.description: analyse how social situations influence food choices

D6D9F9BE261C419FAD537732D51FD9DB.description: explain how childhood eating habits can influence lifelong eating patterns

06F07828A8694088B26A165D626AD5D2.description: explain how personal, family, and community resources (e.g., money, time, knowledge, ability, equipment, availability of foods) influence personal food choices

FBD8DFA650ED429E91EC3D80E0C03E5D.description: identify different factors that influence people's food choices (e.g., nutritional, cultural, emotional, environmental, religious, social, ethical, economic)

0E64DE8D87A3465AB0EC21E41FAE4E10.description: Influences on Food Choices: demonstrate an understanding of various factors that influence food choices;

EFC176E7E42141E5AF2771545D182EF2.description: plan and prepare a food item or items to address specific food needs (e.g., the need for a low-sodium diet, a low-cholesterol diet, a healthy diet for a person with a hectic schedule)

AC34D90525E545B0A23706F9D8400F02.description: describe ways in which household members can contribute to the provision of food both inside and outside the home (e.g., planning meals, shopping for food, preparing food, cleaning up)

5089310CCF2C4EB4B3D2FF84BB03C795.description: describe effective strategies to use in selecting, preparing, and serving food to meet a variety of food needs (e.g., creating a budget, estimating per-serving costs, using coupons, planning menus and meals, developing appropriate food-preparation skills and techniques, preparing foods in advance)

69F247B597464287A51EE816535D47C6.description: describe factors that affect people's food needs (e.g., food preferences, dietary and health needs, busy schedules, major life changes)

4462E8B6715543E09DDBBD4A0F8B4BCD.description: Food Needs: demonstrate an understanding of factors affecting people's food needs and of ways of meeting those needs;

E6B7E92E72B644B9A00FC6845801BA22.description: outline strategies for achieving and maintaining a positive body image and healthy attitudes about food (e.g., critically examining media messages, educating oneself about trends, using positive self-talk, setting priorities, participating in varied activities, talking with others)

2A834AAE9DB241AF8B192E73BB25A327.description: describe and evaluate some current theories about the relationship between body type/shape and health (e.g., different shapes can be healthy; waist circumference is a predictor of diabetes and stroke risk)

747ACBB1F97B414B894731FB153B67CA.description: describe positive and negative influences on body image (e.g., cultural, social, media, peer group, family)

82404D1B013C47ABA229475A59C5B1E8.description: Body Image and Attitudes about Food: demonstrate an understanding of factors that contribute to a positive body image and healthy attitudes about food.

3BAACC8D700E4802B1D46143750C7816.description: plan and prepare a snack and/or breakfast food that is nutrient dense

76E425B6EA4D428E803A5F5CDC86F0D2.description: assess their own eating patterns and create a personal eating plan to achieve optimal physical health

77D9092CE8954A31947EE223EFA3C743.description: evaluate existing programs and policies that encourage eating for optimal health (e.g., breakfast programs, school food and beverage policies, trans-fat regulations)

3CDBDA951DC843D884EC424F06315AF5.description: describe the role of healthy snacking in achieving and maintaining optimal health (e.g., meeting nutrient needs, satisfying hunger between meals, providing energy)

FCCE16149A1040A7BE9030AE753654CD.description: describe the role of healthy snacking in achieving and maintaining optimal health (e.g., meeting nutrient needs, satisfying hunger between meals, providing energy)

1C896A52B84A4F7C908EE45AEF1EA0F0.description: explain why it is important to eat a nutritious breakfast (e.g., to improve mood, energy level, school performance, workplace productivity)

78ED93B281EC4550B348C77A0C9CF4EB.description: explain the differences between nutrientdense foods and empty-calorie foods and their effects on health

92E17E3481C64956A6C2D0B135E540AE.description: Eating Patterns: demonstrate an understanding of eating patterns that contribute to optimal physical health;

1B8F6E793BC5452EA055BE56D2419428.description: plan nutritionally adequate meals using the guidelines in Canada's Food Guide

DECFE230FA7A4C64847750E00F9439AA.description: interpret the information on the labels of a variety of packaged foods (e.g., Nutrition Facts table, ingredient list, nutrient claims) to determine their nutritional content

DF84B7F646254E508E931BD7E5877240.description: describe people's nutritional needs at different stages in the lifespan, as outlined in Canada's Food Guide

F06E6729567E4A15B0EE06D130352702.description: identify key nutrients, their sources and functions, and the food groups in which they can be found (e.g., carbohydrates in the Grain Products group, protein in the Meat and Alternatives and Milk and Alternatives groups)

8FEC68A4E29C4DCA9358F02DD4D36E39.description: describe appropriate serving sizes as defined in Canada's Food Guide

06ACC4D67C0041568A47F58B0C033B59.description: describe diverse foods within each of the food groups as described in Canada's Food Guide

CC6616AB5DED4C528F620692DBE2036A.description: describe the key messages and recommendations in Canada's Food Guide (e.g., food illustrations included, foods emphasized, statements about exercise)

D98C122D99FE44C4A08BD03EDA5CA0AD.description: Canada's Food Guide: demonstrate an understanding of the nutritional and health recommendations in Canada's Food Guide;

94DB89AE46D044C787A2029C3FD2F48D.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

068647DB248A4CC2A6D9C1E1B0FCB020.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style)

CAA7CF1AA0A04C4D9F3A14931F1CED21.description: use terms relating to food and nutrition correctly (e.g., nutrients, nutrient-dense foods, snacking, body image, food security)

2F7755393F75479D9E37BD9142330D12.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, brochure, flyer, poster, report, multimedia presentation, web page) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

1F02CE4FE50746E984EB932D3D1AEBFC.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., weigh and connect information to determine the answer to their research question)

1B88814EAB6C49588CEEB3F47839FA42.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

567F0654E03041E9BDDEA66A42CFBA44.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare results of surveys and interviews; determine whether common themes arise in different sources)

83F77980045A403597A34E83A7ACAAE5.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats (e.g., notes, graphic organizers, audio/visual/digital records)

EB7A44B1BFEE4267AACED88F51D228F0.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

0A14225FBE754970855BEAF6452FFB92.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry;

EC842CE37E2B4ECFBF4BAC611AF48633.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or research question, and use it to focus their research

8BFA31426C9D4F8F8BA6B323C6EFD190.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., informal interviews and surveys, personal food journals, data sets from Statistics Canada) and/or secondary sources (e.g., textbooks, advertisements, brochures, newspaper and magazine articles, online encyclopedias)

279E4ED3541642CB9EDE42D7EB63AF06.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., outline purpose and method; identify sources of information; develop research tools such as surveys or questionnaires), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

8549CBD4C45D45F7B997730585222952.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate social science research and inquiry methods;

6F7CE1E6D06A45AE83B6ED22585C6E24.description: ormulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

8C1EA8ECE11946C3843F25449490EC10.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their selected topics

1DEBC9BF57BA414A97B6AC700960561B.description: explore a variety of topics related to food and nutrition (e.g., Canadian food regulations, food safety, school food regulations) to identify topics for research and inquiry

E2A5ED71C70641128CF76D9996B5730B.description: Exploring: explore topics related to food and nutrition, and formulate questions to guide their research;
